result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher A Hartson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Christopher A Hartson in court, in custody, with Attorney Donna Kuchler for Attorney Anthony D Cotton.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  This case is dismissed and read-in for Defendant's plea to Case #15CM880.

Defendant to post an additional $500.00 ($500.00 already posted). Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to comply with WCS assessment or any recommendation that they make. Defendant to sign release to authorize such monitoring.

Defendant Christopher A Hartson in court, in custody, with Attorney Anthony D Cotton.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant.  State requests an increase in cash bail.  Court increases cash bail.  Previous court dates set remain on.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Non compliance with WCS. Br. 4 only.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing at 12-10-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant to post an additional $250.00. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.  Defendant to comply with WCS assessment or any recommendation that they make. Defendant to sign release to authorize such monitoring.

Defendant Christopher A Hartson in court with attorney Anthony D Cotton.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Cotton request that the capias be quashed. Court will quash capias based on the Defendant's appearance. Parties address WCS letter/non compliance. State requests bail be modified to $5000.00 cash bail on each case, as previously ordered. Court will amend bond. Atty Cotton requests a jury trial date. Jury trial set on 15CM880.  Hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program  Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
